ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is a hands-on teaching course that is looking at critically at pedagogical techniques while navigating the particularly tricky subject of music theory.

Summary: rare opportunity for a hands-on experience, relatively light workload, invaluable experience to teach in front of peers and experienced instructor, don't expect too much from reviews or discussion of readingsYes, I would recommend this class to a fellow student for the positive reasons given above.
Absolutely yes. Professor Harrison is a master teacher, and it behooves any aspiring teacher to learn from his experience and methods.

Music 904 offers an opportunity to acquire strategies and practice for teaching music theory. I would recommend the course to any music theory student, because these skills are an essential and very significant part of the job for which we are preparing.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course provided an excellent review of teaching resources, which will obviously come in handy throughout our careers as educators.

Although Music 904 might not contribute directly to my research, the practical experience that this course provides for learning how to teach is invaluable. Furthermore, the readings and textbook reviews greatly improved my knowledge of the history of American theory pedagogy and will help me to make informed decisions about my teaching ideology.
